cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the complexity of inverse problems in approximate uniform generation, which involves generating a probability distribution that is close to the uniform distribution over the satisfying assignments of a Boolean function. This topic is closely related to computational complexity theory and cryptography, which suggests that cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) are likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of algorithms for approximate counting and statistical query learning, which are topics in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper discusses specific classes of Boolean functions, such as halfspaces and DNF formulas, which suggests that cs.CY (Computers and Society) may also be a relevant sub-category.
